intro: Halosciastrum crassum, commonly known as the broad-leaved halophyte, is a flowering plant native to saline environments. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to arid and salty conditions. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. Its root system is highly specialized to absorb and tolerate high concentrations of salt. Halosciastrum crassum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils in coastal and saline habitats.
